column1: AI Coach with Full Data Awareness
column2: Ask questions, get answers referencing YOUR training history, patterns, physiology, upcoming plan, and race goals
column3: Garmin AI summaries, Runna post-run insights
column4: They summarize single workouts. Dreamy reasons across your entire history.

column2: Every metric has an expandable explanation of inputs, formulas, time constants
column3: Runalyze documents formulas in help docs
column4: Nobody shows the math INLINE next to the metric in the UI.

column2: Cross-reference sleep, weather, TSB, shoes, time-of-day, previous load to explain any workout
column4: Nobody does multi-factor explanation for individual running workouts.

column2: After adjusting for ALL confounders: which shoe actually makes you faster?
column4: Nobody controls for weather, grade, fatigue, time-of-day in shoe comparison.

column2: TRIMP weighted by heat stress index — hot runs count for more stress
column3: Klimat annotates weather; nobody adjusts load
column4: Nobody modifies the actual training load calculation based on conditions.

column2: 'You PR when CTL is 50-55 and TSB is +5 to +8' → 'Race in the next 10 days'
column4: Nobody detects YOUR personal performance patterns across months of data.

column2: Who likes your runs, when they stopped, engagement trends by activity type
column4: Nobody analyzes kudos PATTERNS — leaderboard, ghost detection, trends.

column2: Gym sessions contribute to fatigue score, running plan adjusts
column4: Nobody unifies strength (RPE × volume) with endurance (TRIMP) into one stress model.

column2: Plan considers busy week, travel, sleep quality, not just workout data
column4: Nobody integrates calendar + travel + biometrics + execution into one adaptive engine.

column2: Detects frustration/anxiety, adjusts tone, remembers emotional patterns
column4: This doesn't exist in any endurance software.
